meanings.definition: To strip of possessions or value
meanings.sent1: The thieves tried to despoil the house of its treasures.
meanings.sent2: The vandals despoiled the museum of its priceless artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The raccoons seemed determined to despoil the picnic basket of all its goodies.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fierce winds threatened to despoil the garden of its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The greedy king sought to despoil the kingdom of its riches.

meanings.sent1: The pirates planned to despoil the merchant ships of their cargo.
meanings.sent2: The bandits despoiled the travelers of their belongings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoons managed to despoil the campsite of all its snacks.
meanings.sent4: The con artist's schemes aimed to despoil the unsuspecting victims of their savings.
meanings.sent5: The invading army sought to despoil the village of its resources.

meanings.definition: To ruin or destroy by force
meanings.sent1: The wildfire threatened to despoil the forest of its lush greenery.
meanings.sent2: The war despoiled the once peaceful town of its prosperity.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician's tricks seemed to despoil the birthday party of its magic.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter frost could despoil the delicate flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The reckless driver's actions could despoil the car of its pristine condition.
